newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Morocco's bank block trade boosts bourse.
newsitem.headline: Morocco's bank block trade boosts bourse.

text.p: The Casablanca stock exchange closed 0.90 percent higher on Monday with a block trade of 1.2 million shares of Banque Marocaine du Commerce Exterieur on the over-the-counter market being the major event of the day.
The all-share index closed at 682.57 points from 676.47 on Friday.

"The increase of German Commerzbank's stake in Morocco's bank was behind the big amount traded," a broker with ABN-AMRO Finance said. The bank said recently it increased its stake in the Moroccan bank to 10 percent from 1.6 percent.
Banque Marocaine du Commerce Exterieur gained 15 dirhams to 635 dirhams 6,295 shares traded.
ONA group closed at 865 dirhams, up 25 from Friday with 13,644 shares exchanged.
Societe Nationale d'Investissement, Morocco's second largest conglomerate, which holds diversified stakes in more than 40 firms, took 10 dirhams to 760 dirhams with 3,907 shares traded.
In the banking sector, the best performer was Banque Commerciale du Maroc which rose 22 dirhans to 970 dirhams with more than 4,136 shares traded.
Leading stock Wafabank edged up one dirham to 893 dirhams with 3,017 shares traded.
Mortgage bank Credit Hotelier et Immobilier lost four dirhams to 306 dirhams with 5,890 shares traded.
First tranche of privatisation bonds issued in January last year remained unchanged at 1,442 dirhams.
Steel mill Sonasid fell 14 dirhams to 605 dirhams with 2,224 shares traded.
Maroc-Leasing gained 16 dirhams to 567 dirhams with 3,073 shares exchanged.
The second larest trade on the over-the-counter market was for 32,000 ONA shares, followed by 30,000 mortgage bank Credit Immobilier et Hotelier shares, ABN-AMRO Finance said.
Total volume on OTC market was 1.13 billion dirhams against 293.4 million last Friday.
Volume on the official market was 97.6 million dirhams from 121.6 million dirhams on Friday.
